basics.name: Francois Boucher
basics.label: Technical Team Lead, Microsoft Azure Advisor
basics.summary: I have been active in the community for over fifteen years. Since 2011, I have been sharing my passion for Windows Azure. You can read me on Frankysnotes.com, and in French on CloudEnFrancais.com.

work.position: Technical Team Lead, Microsoft Azure Advisor
highlights: Lead a dedicated team of developers in the advancement of technology in the mobile, air, and telecommunication industries.
Help Microsoft Partners to leverage their solutions by using Windows Azure Services.
Develop proof of concept, migrate solution, architect application using Windows Azure.
Give training and presentations.
Develop integration interfaces and web applications.
Develop secure web portals.
Develop a system of phonetic/alphanumeric search.
Develop web tools for testing process.
Develop Mobile Application - System Developer.
Develop a graphic control to draw diagrams.
Develop an add-in to Visual Studio 2005 to generate code, validation and unit test with graphical tools
Develop a point of sales, inventory management tools, web services, development and maintain robot to transfer data between locations.
User Support cross the Canada and Unit test.
Nirvana Team DBA.
Web development.
Create and develop an object engine to improve the application time development.
Creation of add-ons for ACOMBA and management tools.
Base classes (OO) development.
Web development
Create and develop a object engine to improve the application time development.
Creation of add-ons for ACOMBA and management tools.
[VB6, VB.NET, C#, XML-XSLT, COM, SQL, PHP OO, ASP, ASP.Net, JavaScript]
Web development: graphic design, database, coding, maintenance of ScoreKeeper (www.sk-hockey.com).
DBA on MySql
[PHP, SQL, Flash, XML, JavaScript]

awards.title: MCP: Designing and Developing Windows Azure Applications
MCP: WCF Development with Microsoft .NET Framework 4

publications.name: Become a better developer
publications.summary: I'm always trying to improve myself. Over the years, I have found some practices that, I believe, are worth sharing. Of course, this is not the ultimate list, but my top five you can do to push yourself to become a better developer.

references.name: Francis Béliveau
references.reference: François est un très bon leader avec beaucoup d’entregents, un apport essentiel à une équipe de travail. Aussi, il est toujours très bien renseigné sur les plus récents façons de faire ou les nouvelles technologies ce qui lui permet de trouver des solutions ingénieuses aux problèmes rencontrés par les clients.
